PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 4, 1943, pg. 14, reads: "Elkdom on Parade! ... Thousands See Colorful Event ... Nation Represented. Tuesday afternoon, the Elks held their famous annual convention parade.  Up and down the hills of Pittsburgh marched the members of the Antlered Herd to the cheers and applause of thousands of spectators.  While not as long as parades in other years, it was still colorful and entertaining... 11. Colorful float of charming feminine Elks from Detroit, Mich. ... - Courier Photos by Harris, Sockwell and Olmstead."
TitMainTitle: Annual Elks parade, with crowd surrounding women of Detroit Elks club wearing hats with stars and riding on float with clock, Wylie Avenue, Hill District
